title: Noteworthy
text:
Close Image 1 of 1 In this April 27, 2013 file picture, Munich's soccer legend Franz Beckenbauer looks on prior to the German first division Bundesliga soccer match between FC Bayern Munich and FC Freiburg in Munich, Germany Germany great Franz Beckenbauer and FIFAs second-ranked official Angel Maria Villar have been investigated by ethics prosecutors and await judgment in their cases, the governing bodys ethics panel confirmed on Wednesday Oct. 21, 2015. AP Photo/Kerstin Joensson,file) ORG XMIT: XBER101 In this April 27, 2013 file picture, Munich's soccer legend Franz Beckenbauer looks on prior to the German first division Bundesliga soccer match between FC Bayern Munich and FC Freiburg in Munich, Germany ... more Noteworthy Back to Gallery 
Beckenbauer a target of FIFA ethics probe 
ZURICH — As the number of World Cup voters publicly accused of wrongdoing reached 17, German soccer great Franz Beckenbauer and FIFA vice president Angel Maria Villar are waiting to discover if they will be found guilty of obstructing the investigation into the 2018 and 2022 World Cup bidding contests. 
Five years after the 2018 tournament was awarded to Russia and the Middle East was given its first World Cup in Qatar in 2022, the shockwaves from the landmark dual decision by a much-discredited FIFA executive committee still reverberate throughout the soccer world. 
Although the Russian and Qatari successes, along with the conduct of rival bids, have been tainted by five years of allegations, FIFA's ethics judge ruled last year there was not enough evidence to prove that the decisions were corrupt. But the contests remain subject to a criminal investigation in Switzerland where the attorney general is examining if there was financial wrongdoing, including money laundering. 
Colleges : The 13th-ranked Florida Gators held a campus-wide tryout for kickers Wednesday afternoon in hopes of finding some help before next week's game against Southeastern Conference rival Georgia in Jacksonville, a huge matchup that will go a long way determining who wins the league's Eastern Division. Coach Jim McElwain said that 216 students applied for the tryout, which was set up after Florida (6-1, 4-1 SEC) lost backup kicker Jorge Powell to a season-ending knee injury during at LSU on Saturday. Starter Austin Hardin also is dealing with a hamstring injury that has kept him out of three games this season. ... An Associated Press source says Texas has reached a 15-year licensing and apparel deal with Nike Inc. that will approach $200 million for the university. 
— Wire reports
